ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to look at the art and think critically about what I saw. I loved learning in an environment with Professor Suthor.

This class makes you get very good at relying on only your observations to interpret art. Rather than focusing on theory, the class gives the students the opportunity to express what compels them and why!

I learned how to closely examine a piece of art in order to understand the artist's choices and the message of a piece. This course gives you the skill to look at art without relying on the descriptions in a museum.
Incredible class. Changed the way I see art by encouraging deeper, extended analysis that is rare today's TikTok attention span world.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Amazing opportunity to go to the museum. Less structured than other classes, but ultimately such a great class.
I think it is a great class
This course was unfortunately very unorganized and lacked structure when it came to grade transparency and expectations. It was difficult to engage if you are not a true art history student.

I loved that we go to have every class in the YUAG. Through taking this class, I really feel like I know the collection well. Professor Suthor did a great job of presenting us with a variety of art, not only one art movement/period of time/artist. However, I thought that the readings did not greatly add to my understanding of the art each week. I also felt that I did not have much guidance in writing my final paper (ie no direction on format, how to structure the argument).
The class is perfect how it is. Was an absolute joy of a seminar that I looked forward to every week. Professor Suthor is incredible.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This was the best class I have ever taken at Yale. I strongly recommend taking it.
yes! such a special opportunity to go to the museum
Yes! Prof. Suthor is very thoughtful and invested in the success of her students. Plus, going to the museum once a week is a great activity!

This is a great course to take if you want to learn how to truly look at art, not just absorb the description given to you by the museum inscription. Just know that you will be looking at one piece of art for a LONG time!
100%. If you're lucky to get a spot, take it.
